column3: str

Eshana is striking a deal with the M tribe.

※Please note that the difficulty of this quest has been synced to your current level. Furthermore, you may not proceed with a class or job that is different from when you accepted this quest.
Speak with the Resistance guard.
Pick up the fragile package.
Carry the fragile package to the Miqo'te merchant at the Peering Stones.
Report to Eshana.
Ah, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. We're in the midssst of preparing a shipment of goods to the M tribe. Might I trouble you for assistance in their delivery?
Normally we would deliver them by cart, but the contentsss of the containers are quite fragile.
We've had no choice but to assemble a band of carriers to sssend them by hand, taking care not to run afoul of the beasts that roam these lands.
Speak with the Resistance guard at the eastern end of the bridge. He will tell you what needs to be carried and to where.
Eshana sent you to help with moving the goods, did she? Well the help's certainly welcome. We've got plenty of packages but too few hands to carry them.
Think you could handle the satchel there on top of the boxes?
You'll be taking it to the Peering Stones. A merchant of the M tribe should be expecting you near the entrance.
Excuse me, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>miss<Else/>sir</If>. Did you happen to come from Castellum Velodyna? I'm expecting a shipment from the Ananta who hold the bridge there, but they've yet to arrive.
Deliver the fragile package to the Miqo'te merchant awaiting you at the specified location at the entrance of the Peering Stones.
You will have two minutes and fifteen seconds to complete the task. Should you fail, return to the starting location and begin anew.
Be wary of attacks from enemies, which will sap your strength.
If you could deliver that satchel there on top of the crates, you'd be helping us more than you know. A merchant from the M tribe will be waiting for you at the entrance to the Peering Stones.
A package from the Ananta? Oh, yes, of course! Pray forgive me, I was expecting a soldier from the Resistance.
To be honest I'm surprised they have any merchandise to sell. Nearly everything they have is sent to the soldiers fighting on the front line.
To be honest I'm surprised they have any merchandise to sell. Nearly everything they have is sent to Ala Mhigo to help with the restoration.
Still, their goldwork and textile goods are quite popular. It's surprisingly easy to reap large profits despite the great sums we pay for their wares.

But I've kept you long enough. Once everything is accounted for it's off to the markets with me. When you return to the castellum, pray tell Eshana I will visit soon to thank her personally, as well as deliver their share of our earnings.

Thanks again for your help, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>miss<Else/>sir</If>. Now you'll want to take that satchel over to the Peering Stones. A merchant from the M tribe will be waiting for you at the entrance.
Back, are we? I was afraid this might happen. Well, there's plenty more to carry, so grab another satchel. Do try to be a little more careful with this one, okay?
Deliver the fragile package to the Miqo'te merchant awaiting you at the specified location at the entrance of the Peering Stones.
You will have two minutes and fifteen seconds to complete the task. Should you fail, return to the starting location and begin anew.
Be wary of attacks from enemies, which will sap your strength.

A few more boxes and I'll be ready to leave to the markets. When you return to the castellum, pray tell Eshana I will visit soon to thank her personally, as well as deliver their share of the profits.
Ah, you are returned. I trust the shipment was sssafely delivered?
Thank goodness. I was concerned they might leave without our wares.
Time with the Resissstance has taught us not everything must be done on our own. It can be advantageousss to work with others, all contributing their unique abilities to accomplish a common goal.
Through the M tribe we can sell our wares. And through adventurers sssuch as yourself, we can more easily secure our livelihood.
Thusss can the Gatekeepers afford to focus their efforts on helping others in need. We all have our part to play if we are to ensure a better tomorrow for Ala Mhigo.
